modName: How to Make a Beautiful Female Character.
summary: A guide to making a beautiful female character as well as a collection of all my mods so far.
descriptionHtml:
[u][color=#93c47d][size=4]Before We Begin..[/size][/color][/u]
So from what I can tell, many Skyrim mod users don't have a clue how to make a quality female character.
Well, fear not. Today you are going to learn how to transform your Skyrim Character into a beautiful woman!

[color=#b4a7d6]First[/color], let me start by saying that you will probably need a decent rig to have a truly good looking character.
4k body textures make a difference, and having an ENB is a WORLD of difference for how your skin will look!
[color=#cc4125][b]
[/b][b]IMPORTANT!!!
[/b][/color][color=#b4a7d6] Second[/color], I would ask that you look up "Skyrim - How to Waifu" on google. This should bring up a webpage that contains Lists of hair mods, body mods, texture mods, etc. You can use this as a guide to find mods you'll want. My guide is going to be focusing on tips, tricks, installation instructions, etc. More of the "How to" stuff.

[color=#b4a7d6]Thirdly[/color], I have written a lot of opinionated statements on things. If you disagree with me that's fine, you can ignore my thoughts and just use the guide for its factual information! Feel free to share your thoughts in the comments.

[u][color=#93c47d][size=4][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/87888-1-1510720534.jpg[/img][/size][/color][/u][u]
[color=#93c47d][size=4]
THINGS you NEED:[/size][/color][/u]
[list]
[*][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/68000/?]XP32 Maximum Skeleton Extended[/url] - this will be your skeleton for animations and hdt physics.[/size]
[*][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/601/?]Realistic Ragdolls and Force[/url] - realistic ragdoll physics.[/size]
[*][size=2]SKSE (free on steam).[/size]
[*][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/11811/?]Fores New Idles in Skyrim (FNIS)[/url] - this allows you to change your animations such as running, jumping, moving, idles, etc.[/size]
[*][size=2]A Body mod (mesh) - the mesh is the shape of your character.[/size]
[*][size=2]A Skin texture - Skin to wrap around your mesh.[/size]
[*][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/53996/?]HDT Physics Extension[/url] - this will allow you to have breast and butt physics, outfits with physics, and hair with physics.[/size]
[*][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/29624/?]RaceMenu[/url] - this is the tool you'll be using to create your Character and change them throughout the game as you see fit.[/size]
[*][size=2]Hair mods - vanilla hair is trash.[/size]
[*][size=2]Animation mods - simply a must have so you don't look like a stiff robot walking around Skyrim.[/size]
[*][size=2]Teeth mods - most skin textures will come with teeth replacer (But some don't so always be sure!)[/size]
[*][size=2]Eye mods - vanilla eyes aren't good.[/size]
[*][size=2][url=https://loot.github.io/]Load Order Optimization Tool (LOOT)[/url] - helps sort your load order![/size]
[*][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/58989/?]CITRUS Heads[/url] - improved head/face meshes![/size]
[*][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/35327/?]SG Eyebrows[/url] - or other eyebrows mods, SG is just my favorite![/size]
[/list][color=#93c47d][size=4][u]IN DEPTH: now let me explain some of these things in detail.
[/u][/size][/color][i][color=#b4a7d6][size=3]-=-RaceMenu v.s. ECE-=-[/size][/color][/i]
[list]
[*][size=2]I have always preferred RaceMenu over Enahanced Character Edit (ECE) due to Racemenu being easier to use with other mods.[/size]
[*][size=2]I will say that I've heard ECE is better for face sculpting if you're into that.[/size]
[*][size=2]Honestly, give both a try and see what you think![/size]
[/list][i][color=#b4a7d6][size=3] -=-Body Mesh-=-[/size][/color][/i]
[list]
[*][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49015/?]UUNP Bodyslide[/url] is a good option since it gives you a high quality body, pre-made body presets, and the ability to make your own custom shaped body.[/size]
[*][size=2]Remember that if you use a CBBE based body mesh - you'll need a CBBE based skin texture. Putting a UNP based skin texture on a CBBE based body mesh (and vice versa) will result in strange texture glitches.[/size]
[*][size=2][url=http://mod.dysintropi.me/high-poly-feet-and-hands-for-unp-bodies/]Halo's High Poly Hands and Feet[/url] - better hands and feet.[/size]
[*][size=2]I do NOT recommend [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/2666/?]CBBE[/url]. Dont let the screenshots fool you! UNP based bodies are higher quality and more real looking. Trust me![/size]
[*][size=2]When I say "UNP based" and "CBBE based" know that I am talking about the 2 families of body types. UNP and CBBE are the original 2. Most other bodies are edited versions of the original, thus they stem from them. For example: [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/36992/?]SevenBase bodies[/url] are UNP based.[/size]
[/list][i][color=#b4a7d6][size=3] -=-Skin Texture-=-[/size][/color][/i]
[list]
[*][size=2]The skin texture MUST match the Mesh.[/size]
[*][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/51602/?]Fair Skin Complexion[/url] is a good choice for its quality and paleness.The installer also includes brows, freckles, teeth, eyes, and HQ makeup.[/size]
[*][size=2]I personally use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/88131]Unslaad Pale UNP[/url]﻿ textures with no freckles. The skin can look very real with a good ENB.[/size]
[*][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/70834/]Demoniac Skin Texture[/url]﻿ - comes with a variety of options to choose from.[/size]
[*][size=2]Picking a skin texture that is at least 2k is important. 4k is great![/size]
[*][size=2]Do NOT get "Better Makeup for SKSE" - this mod will lag the heck out of RaceMenu! Instead choose a skin texture that has high res makeup built in. Examples: Fair Skin Complexion or Demoniac.[/size]
[/list][i][color=#b4a7d6][size=3] -=-Sweaty/Oily Skin (Optional)-=-[/size][/color][/i]
[list]
[*][size=2]There are two methods to achieve oily/wet/sweaty skin (if you want it). One uses NifSkope, the other is tweaking your ENB ini. Both have Pros and Cons.[/size]
[*][size=2][i][color=#00ffff]Pros & Cons of nifskope[/color][/i]: It will NOT change the look of your world, only your character. However, you have to do the process for every single outfit you want the oily skin on.[/size]
[*][size=2][i][color=#00ffff]Pros & Cons of ENB ini edit[/color][/i]: this WILL change the look of your world. However, you only have to do the process once and it applies to everything in the game.[/size]
[*][size=2][b][color=#00ff00]Method 1 (NifSkope)[/color][/b]: Download and Install Nifskope. Open your body meshes using NifSkope. Under BShadingLightingProperties, edit the values "Glossiness" and "Specular Strength". Anything between 60-800 for "Glossiness" and 5-10 in "Specular Strength" will make the oily look, keep in mind that every texture is different so you'll have to spend some time tweaking it to get the right values. You have to edit both the _0 and _1 of the body, hands and feet meshes to make it work. That will be 6 meshes to edit for your body as well as each outfit you want to have oily skin with! Here is a video to help with the process: [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IPLif1dY78w]Link[/url][/size]
[*][size=2][color=#00ff00][b]Method 2 (ENB tweak)[/b][/color]: Get an ENB, I recommend Grim and Somber ENBs. Now get Demoniac High Quality Glossy Female Body Texture. Once you are in game, zoom out to see your character. Open console window so that when you tweak your ENB, your character isn't swinging their sword around. Open your ENB's in game editor (you'll have to find the hotkey for it) and look for the "Environment" section. Under this section you should find two sets of lines. One set all starts with "SpecularAmountMultiplier" and the other "SpecularPowerMultiplier". Changing the Specular Amounts will change the amount of gloss. Changing the Specular Power will change the power of the gloss (the size of the reflection spots and streaks). Here is a Video to help with that: [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cEj8eV1gpEs]Link[/url][/size]
[/list] [size=2]
[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/87888-6-1510720533.jpg[/img]

[/size][color=#93c47d][size=4][u]ANIMATION MODS: some recommendations and how to use them.[/u][/size][/color]
[list]
[*][size=2]FNIS and XP32 are gonna be your friends here. You need to run FNIS after every animation install and uninstall. [/size]
[*][size=2]Running animation: [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/77343/?]Realistic Animation Project - Movement[/url][/size][size=2]. And we have [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50078/?]Female Running and Walking Animation[/url] (it's more.. exaggerated). [/size]
[*][size=2]Walking animation: you can use the previous ones or you could use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/13272/?]Victorias High Heel walk Animation[/url].[/size]
[*][size=2]Jumping: [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/78593/?]Her Animations[/url] - use the file "Her Jump" or [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/56118/?]Pretty Jump Animations[/url] or [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/16069/?]Jump Animations[/url].[/size]
[*][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/15703/?]Pretty Combat Animations[/url] - self explanatory.[/size]
[/list][list]
[*][size=2]Sometimes I have issues getting animations to work. If this is the case, then install [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/36992/?tab=2&navtag=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Fskyrim%2Fajax%2Fmodfiles%2F%3Fid%3D36992&pUp=1]SevenBase (TBBP version)[/url] and don't let it overwrite anything except XP32 skeleton. For some odd reason replacing the skeleton has worked for me at times. This mod also comes with Female Running and Walking Animation as well as the Victoria High Heel Walk (negating the need to install those). [/size]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][u][color=#93c47d][size=4]HAIR MODS: Some recommendations and info on HDT hairs.[/size][/color][/u]
[list]
[*][size=2]HDT hairs require HDT physics. Run FNIS when you install/uninstall them just for the heck of it -Oddly it has solved some of my issues before.[/size]
[*][size=2]HDT hairs can be hard to find. Google search and see what you come up with. A well known one is [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/70363/?]KS Hairdos - HDT Physics[/url] (get the bbp fix too).[/size]
[*][size=2]My recommendations are [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/68311/?]KS Hairdos Renewal[/url] and [url=http://robton.nu/ks-cazy-hairs/]KS Cazy Hairs[/url].[/size]
[*][size=2]For Vanilla hair replacement, I suggest [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/36510/?]Superior Lore Friendly Hair[/url], or [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/82708/?]Shiva's Vanilla Hair Replacer[/url].[/size]
[/list]
[color=#93c47d][size=4][u]EYE MODS: Some suggestions and tips.[/u][/size][/color]
[list]
[*][size=2]I recommend this mod: [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/13722/?]The Eyes of Beauty[/url]. Fair Skin Complexion comes with an eyes replacer that is decent, but this mod does it better.[/size]
[*][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/35327/?]SG Eyebrows[/url] is a great mod! You should look at other eyebrow mods as well to see if there is anything you like more.[/size]
[*][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/67447/?]Improved Eye Reflection and Cube Map[/url] - pretty self explanatory. [/size]
[*][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27783/?]HN66s Long Eye Lashes[/url] - Gives you long eyelashes. [b][color=#00ff00]NOTE[/color][/b][color=#ffffff]:[/color] "The Eyes of Beauty" makes the eye lashes longer on its own. RaceMenu also has a slider for making eyelashes longer.[/size]
[*][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/13457/?]Face Light[/url] - will put a light on your face so your eyes shine and aren't covered by shadows. [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/71063/?]Face Light Plus[/url] glitches for me so I don't use it.[/size]
[/list]
[color=#93c47d][size=4][u]CLOTHING and ARMOR:[/u][/size][/color]
[list]
[*][size=2]For Re-texturing Vanilla outfits, you can use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/69784/?]Rustic Clothing[/url]. For the Armor you should use either [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/29167/?]amb's re-texture[/url] or [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/3261/?]Hvergelmir's Re-texture[/url].[/size]
[*][size=2]For replacing your vanilla armor, we've got two splendid options. (1) [url=http://robton.nu/vanilla-armors-and-clothes-tmb/]Robton's TMB Re-placer[/url]. (2) [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/85411/?]UUNP Vanilla Outfits BodySlides[/url].[/size]
[*][size=2][b][color=#00ff00]NOTE[/color][/b]: The TMB armor re-placer is intended for the TMB Body, however you don't need it to use the re-placers.[/size]
[*][size=2]For Immersive armor re-texture you can use this: [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/29167/?]AmidianBorn Textures for Immersive Armors[/url][/size]
[*][size=2]For Immersive armors, there is a UUNP Skimpy Immersive Armor Mashup - you can google that, because I might get in trouble for linking it.[/size]
[*][size=2]There is also this: [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/80167/?]Immersive Armors CBBE and UUNP Refit[/url] to be more true to the original mod.[/size]
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/75861/?]The Book of UUNP[/url] - adds tons of variety to your armors. Amazing Mod.
[/list]
[color=#93c47d][size=4][u]MODDED OUTFITS:[/u][/size][/color]
[list]
[*][size=2]TESmistel's tumblr.[/size]
[*][size=2]wtfuun's "Skyrim Shitty UUNP HDT" Tumblr.[/size]
[*][size=2]JR's Conversions and Malfdawg's Conversions on the site that shall not be named..[/size]
[*][size=2][url=https://skyrimscandal.blogspot.com/]Skyrim Scandal[/url] - this is your best source for high quality conversions! It is constantly updated with new outfits and armors![/size]
[*][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/64905/?]AddItemMenu[/url] - this is a great mod that will let you access all your downloaded outfits from convenient menus.[/size]
[*][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/67309/?]KS Jewelry[/url] - Lots of new jewelry to put on your character. [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/64283/?]Immersive Jewelry[/url] adds tons of jewelry as well (if you wanna sift through 4200+ pieces).[/size]
[*][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/63920/?]Test HDT Earrings[/url] - adds a few sets of HDT earrings (they are pretty cool!)[/size]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][u][size=2][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/87888-0-1510766444.jpg[/img]
[/size][color=#93c47d][size=4]
MY MODS: the files are all here in the files section, but I linked them in case you want a more detailed look![/size][/color][/u]
[i][color=#b4a7d6]-=-UUNP BodySlide Presets-=- [/color]
[/i][list]
[*][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/85202/?]Dangerous Curves[/url] - A slim and somewhat realistic body. Very Cute looking.[/size]
[*][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/86182/?]Babe Body[/url] - This was my first success at making high cleavage breasts for outfits without looking hideous when you take clothes off.[/size]
[*][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/87798/?]Dangerously THICC[/url] - Basically [url=http://www.lol-wallpapers.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/Sona-by-cal-2-HD-Wallpaper-Fan-Art-Artwork-League-of-Legends-lol-2.jpg]Sona from League of Legends[/url]. An improved version of the babe body with insane curves.[/size]
[*][size=2][b][color=#00ff00]NOTE[/color][/b]: these presets are UUNP hdt. Not UUNP HDT Special![/size]
[/list] [color=#b4a7d6][size=3][i]-=-RaceMenu Presets-=-[/i][/size][/color]
[list]
[*][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/85199/?]Amelia Rose[/url] - Best with Extra THICC body. Brunette Nord with green eyes and medium length hair, kind and loving face.[/size]
[*][size=2][b][color=#00ff00]NOTE[/color][/b]: I have an [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/85344/?]Amelia Rose Follower[/url] <<<Link.[/size]
[*][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/87859/?]Hell Girl[/url] - Best with SevenBase Body. Red Skin, Daedric tattoos, yellow eyes, black ponytail, fierce face.[/size]
[*][size=2][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/87860/?]Young Elf[/url] - Best Used with dangerous curves Body.[/size]
[*][size=2][color=#00ff00][b]NOTE[/b][/color]: all of the RaceMmeu presets are Nord race. However, the sculpt files can apply the face to other races![/size]
[*][size=2]Also check >[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/88004]HERE[/url]﻿< to see tons of user requested presets I have made![/size]
[*][size=2]If you like my content, track me as an author![/size]
[/list]
[color=#93c47d][size=4][u]Installation: lets get down to business.[/u][/size][/color][list]
[*][size=2]Download all the mods you want.[/size]
[*][size=2]Install Racemenu.[/size]
[*][size=2]Install XP32 Skeleton and Realistic Ragdolls. Let XP32 Overwrite Rag Dolls. In XP32 installer, choose HDT rigging. Ignore combat animation options.[/size]
[*][size=2][b][color=#00ff00]NOTE[/color][/b]: XP32 must overwrite everything (except SevenBase if u got it for the animations fix)[/size]
[*][size=2]Install FNIS and HDT Physics. HDT physics will NOT overwrite XP32.[/size]
[*][size=2]Now Install your body mod of choice. Do not overwrite XP32. Do not overwrite HDT physics.[/size]
[*][size=2][b][color=#00ff00]NOTE[/color][/b]: If you are installing BodySlide and Outfit Studio. Be sure to select only the UUNP options.[/size]
[*][size=2]Install skin texture mods. This should overwrite everything.[/size]
[*][size=2]Install Halo's Hands and Feet. Let it overwrite everything.[/size]
[*][size=2]Install animation mods. These can overwrite XP32 so long as it's not overwriting the actual skeleton for some whatever reason.[/size]
[*][size=2]All your other mods past this point shouldn't have any overwrite conflicts. If they do, it should be pretty self explanatory what is supposed to take priority. For example the armor re-placers overwrite the armor re-textures.[/size]
[/list][size=2]
[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/87888-7-1510720532.jpg[/img]
[/size]
[color=#93c47d][size=4][u]BodySlide Preset Installation Instructions:[/u][/size][/color]
[list]
[*][size=2]Download and Extract my File.[/size]
[*][size=2]Go to Skyrim>>Data>>CalienteTools>>BodySlide>>SliderPresets>>(put the file in here!)[/size]
[*][size=2]Start BodySlide program, select this body from among the UUNP HDT presets, batch build, done![/size]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][color=#93c47d][size=4][u]RaceMenu Preset Installation Instructions:[/u][/size][/color]
[list]
[*][size=2]Download and extract my files.[/size]
[*][size=2]Main Skyrim Folder > Data > SKSE > Plugins > CharGen (This is where the sculpt files go).[/size]
[*][size=2]Now go into the presets folder that is within the CharGen folder - (This is where the jslot RaceMenu preset will go).[/size]
[*][size=2]Go in game, type into console window "showracemenu" without the quotes. Now go to sculpting tab and press F9 to import your sculpt files.[/size]
[*][size=2]Now go to the presets tab and press F9 again to import your preset.[/size]
[/list]
[u][color=#93c47d][size=4]ENB's and Lighting:[/size][/color][/u]
[list]
[*][size=2]I use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50501/?]Grim and Somber's Azura ENB[/url]. It is very high quality but requires a powerful computer. It takes away about 20 frames![/size]
[*][size=2]As far as a lighting mod, you are probably gonna want to use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50065/?]Natural Lighting and Atmospherics[/url]. Other lighting mods made indoors too bright and gave my character an awful shine near light sources.[/size]
[*][size=2]G&S Azura + Natural Lighting and Atmospherics is what allowed me to make those screenshots^[/size]
[/list][i][color=#b4a7d6][size=3]
Thank you to everyone who took the time to read this guide and check out my mods, I really appreciate it. I hope that everything works well for you in your installation. Please let me know if this helped you or if you learned anything. I may consider making another guide, but this time on Skyrim's landscapes.[/size][/color][/i]
author: wnisewond
